text: Hey everyone! I need some help while creating contacts :thread:

I am trying to create contacts using the batch create api. I get the error
```{"status":"error","message":"Contact already exists. Existing ID: 20775093475","correlationId":"467b6d05-30d1-4bb5-b097-de74e808dcba","category":"CONFLICT"}```
which causes the batch to fail, thus all contacts that are part of this batch are failed to be created.

Even though the error says that the Contact already exists, this is not the case, because I've checked my contacts and the ones I'm trying to create and they dont exist in HubSpot.
Do you have any idea?

:wave: Hello, team! i am using the single email api to send the mail to contact , but i also want to log the email in the activities under the contact , the email is logging but its not showing the content of email
Is there a question or something you are looking for me to answer? I’m sorry, I’m not sure what you require of me.

Hi <@U25PYL3Q8>, this is the existing setup into our website. Somehow it is not working for all contacts. If you could see the above details & let us know your thoughts on this about how we can fix this. Thank you.

<#C2YHAHB6K|api> Hello All just wondered if anyone knows the answer to the following in regards to Bulk API usage when a record failure happens....
*An existing integration from SALESFORCE to HubSpot is using the "crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/update" hubspost API for updating contacts in BULK. The API support multiple records in the "request", but it seems that in case one of the records generates an error, the API in the "response" is not able to provide a line error and the full batch of the records will not be updated.* 
*Could anyone confirm that there are additional ways how to get the "response" at a detailed error level and/or process the records on the line level, without sending singular records in the call?*
*Thank you*:slightly_smiling_face:
One of the emails in your payload already exists as primary email or secondary email
but I've check and they dont exist

Hi, I am trying to resolve something in theory first, before bugging my devs with setting up the API.

Basically, example is very similar to how Slack operates - 1 user with 1 email can join many workspaces that are free, paid on different plans, etc. Question is, can we reliably feed this info not on a user level, but on custom property level "Workspace subscription" and all those users who are part of workspace sub = free be fed into a workflow email funnel for example?
Please do check for secondary emails. A contact with same additional email might exist.
can anyone assist ?
hey developers i need some helo about the log email
Emails in uppercase? Maybe?

typically I do 1:1 testing and validation of data before moving to the batch updates. That way you get all the bugs out before moving to do  everything all at once.

Do you have an example of the error message you have received?

Are you also logging out the data that is moving in this?

I usually tail my logs and review the input/output data flow of each object as well as the error message and determine where the error is.

If you have the error message maybe I can point you in the right direction?

Can you pose your theory in HubSpot terms and not Slack terms? That might help someone address this.

Can you add a property to a contact? Yes
Can you make a dropdown values of this? yes

Can you create a contact workflow that checks your property value before getting into the workflow, yes.

Not sure what the api has to do with this — let me know if this helps or if you have more information

If you put more information in here about what you have done ,screenshots, etc then people might be able to assist you when they have some time.

If I'

If I’m driivng down the road and I’m 10 minutes early to my destination —

If I see someone with their tire off pulled over on the side of the road, I know I have 10 minutes to help them.

If I see someone with their hood open pulled over on the side of the road, I can’t stop to help because I don’t have enough time for that.

Same thing here “hey developers I need help about the log email”

I’ve spent all of my time now, going through peoples questions and asking them more information. If people just put the information in these posts, then I could have actually answered people’s questions with the time I had available, instead I’m just asking for more information.

Sorry I might not be explaining this well.

I was just giving an example with Slack, as everyone here is familiar with it (the 1 user can be part of many slacks)

Isnt the API the main way to feed user data per property/custom property/custom event etc? What channel is best appropriate for this?
If this data is coming form an outside source, yes you can use the api to update contacts for a property.
They should be able to figure this out if you ask them
Yeah, the important thing for me was if it was possible in HS as it is not in other platforms (for example Active Campaign). Thanks!
hey
sorry for the late reply
can you screenshot what you are referring to by what you are seeing in the log?
yeah sure
here my email are logging but its not showing the content

Gotcha, so I’m guessing you have some variable data going into each of these emails, and when you send them out via transaction email, you’d like to see the actual body of the email that went out.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Visibility-of-the-real-Sent-Transactional-Email-Body/idi-p/906751>

that isn’t somethign that is possible at the moment.
That being said — you could add a note to the contact with the email body in it just after the transactional email sends and that would be a great way to store that data so it is reviewable on the contact record.

My workaround for just about anything related to issues in HubSpot is create a note with the data, make sure to give it a good title
after the transactional email i am using the create email api to create the log and make the body then send it to the api but still not showing this

Hello Devs,
Question with the hubdb drag and drop order, is there a way in the api to revert the drag and drop order?

I dont want to sort by created date or id, I want the reverse of whats showing after the client is sorting it with the drag and drop
Thanks!
Thanks Nicholas! Just needed to confirm with someone as the doc was a bit confusing between private/public app and the tiers..
The <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact|v1 contacts api> supports `&showListMemberships=true`
<@U0409G46R7B> Can you post the link to this idea?  I'd love to up-vote it
The API has been updated <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/workflows#create-a-workflow>
With v3 lists api, you can query `/crm/v3/lists/records/{objectTypeId}/{recordId}/memberships` to get the lists that a record belongs to.
I've submitted this idea <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Lists-v3-API-should-have-option-to-expose-member-details/idi-p/998441>

I’m not sure I understand. I just outlined that the email body doesn’t show up in the timeline, that it isn’t a feature of HubSpot.

I said that if you want this data to appear in the timeline, you could pass all the email data to a note and attach the note to the contact that you just emailed.

What is your question?

When you pull those items in via the api, you would just loop in reverse. If you are doing this in hubl you would do `{% set reverse_items = all_items|reverse %}` or something similar I would think.

you can use .reverse() in JS or a ffew other ways, you could do a for loop and work backwards doing the iterator like `i--`
the tracking code is stored in a cookie — that is the way I retrieve it using JS
I’m doing it with React, I’m using pagination as well and I don’t want to reverse the oldest 10 items, I want to revert the full response of the api.
Is there a way to then send that to the API though? I can't find any way to actually store it against the contact.

so using the tracking code and sending that data to HubSpot is generally done from a webpage or a webapp.

Typically this is done when you are sending a form submission. That is how you tie the user’s tracking code to the user.

If you are doing an api call like creating a contact, this is typlically from “offline” activity

does that make sense?

Yeah, it does make sense ... but I don't really understand why I can't also send it from the python client. We've consolidated everything to integrate with HubSpot in our server-side application to keep all the logic in the same place. I can get the cookie from the request made from our web app to our server-side API so I should therefore be able to send that on to the HubSpot API with everything else that's available to the server side.

Hey everyone,
I am trying to create a custom module so that I can use it my webpage. I have to make a POST API call where I will be able to send the user entered data to the hubSpot form. How do I store the API token without exposing it?
My question is to show the email body like the email body shows in the sales email
